episode.title: EoS ByteCast — Seed Orchard ZIP Export + Multi-Journey Quest Map

content.summary_short: End-of-session update: ByteCast loop v2 is live with multi-journey quest maps, proof badges, and runnable ZIP seed exports.
content.summary_long: This EoS ByteCast recaps what shipped: a config-driven loop controlled by data/journey_steps.json, quest map rendering across Playlist/Training/Orchard, proof-based badge minting (with minProof), and Seed Orchard exporting runnable ZIP packs seeded from the canonical template.

slides.title: Today’s headline
bullets: ByteCast is now a platform: multi-journey + quest map + proof badges + runnable seed packs.
The loop is real, visible, and extendable without rewriting UI.

slides.title: The Spine
bullets: data/journey_steps.json controls steps, CTAs, order, and badge rules.
No hardcoded handoffs required for the main loop surfaces.
Progress is stored per journey: bytecast.workflow.v2.<journeyId>.

slides.title: Quest Map Everywhere
slides.goal: Make the loop obvious on every surface.
bullets: Shared renderer powers Playlist, Training Hub, and Orchard.
Grouped + collapsible steps scale to longer tracks.
One primary CTA always points to the next step.

slides.title: Badges Got Teeth
bullets: Central badge enforcement in the loop engine.
Optional minProof is validated before minting.
badge_minted includes journeyId for clean analytics.

slides.title: Seed Orchard: Real Artifacts
slides.goal: Seeder output is runnable, not conceptual.
bullets: Seeded from the canonical template baseline.

items.text: I can explain what controls the loop.
I know where progress is stored per journey.
I can export a runnable ZIP from Seed Orchard.

questions.q: What is the single source of truth for the loop?
questions.explain: The loop is config-driven from JSON so you can add/remove steps without rewriting UI.
Per-journey storage prevents collisions as journeys expand.

questions.q: What makes Seed Orchard export valuable?
choices: It exports a runnable pack ZIP with proof payload
questions.explain: Export produces a real artifact and records proof for badges.

aerovista_about.summary: AeroVista ships modular packs (episodes, training, tools) connected by a thin, config-driven loop engine.
